channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Simple Solutions to Big Problems
item.description: With excellent benefits, an excellent salary package, and an engineering culture that focuses on excellence, simply delivered, isnâ€™t it time for a simple life?

item.title: Largest Perl team in London with beautiful Docklands offices
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers

item.title: Independent thinkers required! Mid/Senior-level Developer for an innovative London company
item.description: This company is renowned for its fast-moving, low-structure environment, where employees are given an impressive lease of freedom to work on projects in their own way and on their own schedule

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: Saturday 3rd November 2018 London

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: September 7-8, 2018 Bern.

item.title: Nordic Perl Workshop and MojoConf 2018
item.description: September 6-7, 2018, Oslo.

item.title: Enforcing commit message format in Git - on the client side
NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Nomad - an alternative to Kubernetes, Docker Swarm & co.
item.description: Interesting blog about Nomad, must read for any DevOps.

item.title: Perl 6 small stuff #5: Gather around, itâ€™s time to get lazy (â€¦but why?)
item.description: Ongoing series by someone who started learning Perl 6 after staying away from programming for few years.

item.title: The 100 Day Plan: The Update on Perl 6.d Preparations
item.description: Zoffix shares the 100 day plan for Raduko Perl 6 compiler release. The code name for the next major release of Perl 6 language, is called Diwali, which is a festival of lights, celebrated by Indians.

item.title: Introducing: Perl 6 Marketing Assets Web App
item.description: Team Perl 6 has setup repo for flyers and brochures for Perl 6. It is a great initiative, Team Perl 5 should do something similar imho.

item.title: 2018.32 Squashathon Done
item.description: Perl 6 Weekly

item.title: Perl Regex superpowers - execute code in substitution - what are /e and /ee ?
Yancy, a simple Mojolicious CMS
item.description: Doug Bell released a new version of Yancy with support for asynchronous database requests using promises.

item.title: Moose Like
item.description: @Byterock explains how 'Like' and 'Not Like' should be dealt with.

item.title: Exploring Type::Tiny Part 3: Using Type::Tie
item.description: Toby has started blog series exploring Type::Tiny. Please follow part 1 and part 2 first.

item.title: 5 Things I Wish I Could Tell My Past Self
item.description: A very interesting and useful guide for someone about to start the career.

item.title: The Secret Life of Objects: Inheritance
item.description: Riccardo explains Inheritance in a way, I have never come across like this before. It forced me to rewire my brain.

item.title: The Perl Conference - what is new?
item.description: A blog about how to make the Perl Events more accommodating as far as First Timers are concerned.

item.title: dev.to is now open source
item.description: dev.to is a place for programmers of all backgrounds and experience levels to learn and share ideas.

item.title: Label your devices in case you lose them! 10% off at StickerYou for the Perl community
item.description: Do you, your kids or your staff lose your phones or other devices way too often? If the lost device is locked, the person who finds it wonâ€™t know whose it is. StickerYou.com is here to help! Order personalized labels for you, your family & your colleagues and stick them to anything you might lose. Use code PERL10 at checkout for 10% off.

item.title: #368 - The Perl Conference in Glasgow
item.description:
Hi there,

Today is the first day of the conference. 13th and 14th August is reserved for workshops (half and full day) conducted by greats like DrForr, Elizabeth Mattijsen, Dave Cross and Andrew Solomon. If you don't want to miss any of the workshops then please go and buy the tickets now.

Post workshops come plenty of talk by some of the great and well respected speakers. This time, you get variety of choices. Here is the full schedule for 15th Aug, 16th Aug and 17th Aug.

And when you are done with The Perl Conference in Glasgow, then kindly take a look at The Nordic Perl Workshop in Oslo on 6th and 7th September 2018. There is still time to submit talks. If you are planning to attend the conference then you can buy the tickets now.

Enjoy the summer while reading this week newsletter.
